output:
Sure! here is the description of CVE-2023-32698: nFPM is an alternative to fpm. The file permissions on the checked-in files were not maintained. Hence, when nfpm packaged 
the files (without extra config for enforcing it’s own permissions) files could go out with bad permissions (chmod 666 or 777). Anyone using nfpm for creating packages without checking/setting file permissions before packaging could result in bad permissions for files/folders.

parsed_raw_data.description:
nFPM is an alternative to fpm. The file permissions on the checked-in files were not maintained. Hence, when nfpm packaged 
the files (without extra config for enforcing it’s own permissions) files could go out with bad permissions (chmod 666 or 777). Anyone using nfpm for creating packages without checking/setting file permissions before packaging could result in bad permissions for files/folders.

instruction: Could you kindly provide a detailed description of CVE with ID: CVE-2023-28763?
output: Certainly, here is the description of CVE-2023-28763: SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform - versions 740, 750, 751, 752, 753, 754, 755, 756, 757, 791, allows an attacker authenticated as a non-administrative user to craft a request with certain parameters which can consume the server's resources sufficiently to make it unavailable over the network without any user interaction.

parsed_raw_data.description: SAP NetWeaver AS for ABAP and ABAP Platform - versions 740, 750, 751, 752, 753, 754, 755, 756, 757, 791, allows an attacker authenticated as a non-administrative user to craft a request with certain parameters which can consume the server's resources sufficiently to make it unavailable over the network without any user interaction.

instruction: Describe the following Common Vulnerability Enumeration (CVE) CVE-2023-1643
output:
Ofcourse. Here is the description of Common Vulnerability Enumeration (CVE) with ID CVE-2023-1643:
A vulnerability has been found in IObit Malware Fighter 9.4.0.776 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function 0x8001E000/0x8001E004/0x8001E018/0x8001E01C/0x8001E024/0x8001E040 in the library ImfHpRegFilter.sys of the component IOCTL Handler. The manipulation leads to denial of service. Attacking locally is a requirement. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-224023.

parsed_raw_data.description: A vulnerability has been found in IObit Malware Fighter 9.4.0.776 and classified as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function 0x8001E000/0x8001E004/0x8001E018/0x8001E01C/0x8001E024/0x8001E040 in the library ImfHpRegFilter.sys of the component IOCTL Handler. The manipulation leads to denial of service. Attacking locally is a requirement. The exploit has been disclosed to the public and may be used. The associated identifier of this vulnerability is VDB-224023.
